00020 #ifndef HASHTABLE_H
00021 #define HASHTABLE_H
00022 
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 
00025 //TODO: Make an iterator!
00026 namespace Pandora
00027 {
00028     namespace
00029     {
00030         //One node in the table.
00031         template<class Key, class Value>
00032         struct Node
00033         {
00034             Key key;
00035             Value *value;
00036         };
00037     } //Anon namespace
00038 
00042     template<class Key, class Value>
00043     class HashTable
00044     {
00045         public:
00046             //Constructor.
00047             HashTable(const size_t& size);
00048             ~HashTable();
00049 
00050             bool insert(const Key& key, const Value& value);
00051             Value& remove(const Key& key);
00052             void removeAll();
00053 
00054             bool exists(const Key& key) const;
00055             Value& find(const Key& key) const;
00056         protected:
00057             size_t m_size;
00058             size_t m_elements;
00059             Node<Key, Value> *m_values;
00060     };
00061 
00062     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00063     //                              Constructor.
00064     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00065     template<class Key, class Value>
00066     HashTable<Key,Value>::HashTable(const size_t& size)
00067     {
00068         m_size = size;
00069         m_elements = 0;
00070         m_values = new Node<Key,Value>[size];
00071     }
00072 
00073     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074     //                              Destructor.
00075     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076     template<class Key, class Value>
00077     HashTable<Key,Value>::~HashTable()
00078     {
00079         for(int i = 0; i < m_size; ++i) {
00080             free(m_values[i]);
00081         }
00082         delete[] m_values;
00083     }
00084 
00085     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086     // Insert a value into the HashTable. Returns false if the table is full or
00087     //          if it hashes to the same value as another element.
00088     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089     template<class Key, class Value>
00090     bool HashTable<Key,Value>::insert(const Key& key, const Value& value)
00091     {
00092         //No spaces free.
00093         if(m_elements == m_size) {
00094             return false;
00095         }
00096 
00097         //Get the index for this element.
00098         int index = key.hashFunction();
00099 
00100         //Crashes with other element
00101         if(m_values[index]) {
00102             return false;
00103         }
00104 
00105         //Successful insertion.
00106         m_values[index] = malloc(sizeof(Node<Key,Value>));
00107         m_values[index]->key = key;
00108         m_values[index]->value = value;
00109         return true;
00110     }
00111 
00112     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00113     //  Remove element from the set, and return the value of the element.
00114     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00115     template<class Key, class Value>
00116     Value& HashTable<Key,Value>::remove(const Key& key)
00117     {
00118         int index = key.hashFunction();
00119 
00120         //If the key doesn't hash to anything we have, or the keys mismatch, we
00121         //return a NULL object.
00122         if(!m_values[index] || m_values[index]->key != key) {
00123             return NULL;
00124         }
00125 
00126         //Found the right element, removing it.
00127         Value tmp = m_values[index]->value;
00128         free(m_values[index]);
00129         m_values[index] = NULL;
00130 
00131         //Return the element we found.
00132         return tmp;
00133     }
00134 }
00135 #endif
